title: There are two parts of a class: the interface and the implementation.

inline_content.Text: There are two parts of a class: the interface and the implementation.

title: The interface is the exposed functionality of the class. Its public methods and variables are part of the interface.

inline_content.Text: The interface is the exposed functionality of the class. Its public methods and variables are part of the interface.

title: The implementation is the internal workings of a class. Other classes shouldn’t need to know about the implementation of a class.

inline_content.Text: The implementation is the internal workings of a class. Other classes shouldn’t need to know about the implementation of a class.

title: Encapsulation refers to the practice of hiding the implementation of a class from any users of that class. This allows the class to make assumptions about its internal state.

inline_content.Text: Encapsulation refers to the practice of hiding the implementation of a class from any users of that class. This allows the class to make assumptions about its internal state.
